marketNews.title: Liquidity Injection Absorption Progress by State-Owned Banks
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Kacaribu, stated that state-owned banks conglomerate (Himbara) has distributed 167.6 trillion rupiah of liquidity injection funds from the government as of October 22, 2025, equivalent to approximately 84% of the total government placement funds. This realization increased by about +48% compared to the distribution value as of October 9, 2025, which reached 113 trillion rupiah (56% of placement). As a detail, Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) have distributed their entire government fund placements, amounting to 55 trillion rupiah each. Meanwhile, Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) remains the bank with the lowest distribution rate at 41%. Responding to this, BBTN President Director, Nixon Napitupulu, said during the 3Q25 earnings call that the remaining funds are targeted to be absorbed in November 2025. See the table above to compare the realization of Himbara credit distribution from government placement funds as of October 22, 2025, and October 9, 2025. BBRI explained that 51% of the government liquidity injection was allocated to the micro segment, while most of the funds received by Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) were focused on the consumer segment. On the other hand, Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) and BMRI only stated that credit distribution was directed to the real sector, such as manufacturing, telecommunications, energy, and agriculture. Febrio added that there is additional fund demand from banks that have completed the distribution of government funds. He explained that the government will conduct an evaluation first, although he believes an additional 50-100 trillion rupiah is still rational as long as the funds are channeled into sectors with a large multiplier effect, such as MSMEs, food, green energy, and public housing.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Credit Growth and Banking Sector Outlook
marketNews.content: Previously, the Ministry of Finance was optimistic that industry-wide credit growth could increase to the +10% YoY level by the end of 2025 - compared to the +7.56% YoY level before the liquidity injection announcement - aligning with the 2025 target which had been downgraded by Bank Indonesia to the range of +8-11% YoY. As of September 2025, an increase in money supply growth (M2) was already visible, as well as the acceleration of the industry-wide credit growth trend to the +7.7% YoY level. The release of this positive data can be a leading indicator for stronger economic growth in 4Q25, after slowing down in 3Q25. For the banking sector itself, the increase in liquidity has driven down the Cost of Funds (CoF) starting from September 2025, based on the 3Q25 earnings call presentations from the big banks. Generally, big bank management hopes that the decrease in CoF can offset the pressure on loan yield so that NIM can be maintained stable, alongside expectations of faster credit growth starting from 4Q25 and into 2026.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Latest Data and Policy Updates
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the growth of adjusted primary money (M0) slowed down in October 2025 to +14.4% YoY to the level of 2,117.6 trillion rupiah (vs. September 2025: +18.6% YoY). This development was influenced by the growth of general bank deposits at adjusted Bank Indonesia amounting to +27.1% YoY and circulated currency amounting to +13.4% YoY. This adjusted M0 growth has considered the impact of liquidity incentives (adjusted monetary control). Bank Indonesia will release a new instrument named BI Floating Rate Note starting November 17, 2025, aimed at deepening the money market, especially developing the overnight index swap (OIS) market. This debt security has a tenor of 1-12 months and can be traded in the secondary market, including for non-resident investors. Additionally, Bank Indonesia will expand the underlying assets for repurchase agreements (repo) in its monetary operations beyond government debt securities and bonds to include other high-quality securities, including corporate bonds, SVBI, and commercial paper. Bank Indonesia will expand the underlying assets for repo starting November 10, 2025. Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of October 2025 increased to $149.9 billion (vs. September 2025: $148.7 billion), driven by government global bond issuance and tax and service receipts, amidst exchange rate stabilization policies. The foreign exchange reserve position at the end of October 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.2 months of imports or 6 months of imports and government foreign debt payments.

marketNews.title: OJK Reviews Regulation to Encourage Consolidation Among KBMI 1 Banks
marketNews.content: The Head of the OJK Authority, Dian Ediana Rae, told Kontan on Thursday (6/11) that the OJK is currently reviewing new regulations to encourage consolidation among small banks belonging to Core Capital Bank Group (KBMI) 1 - excluding regional development banks. With this new regulation plan, OJK targets the bank groups to be reduced to only 3 groups.

marketNews.title: Residential Property Price Survey Shows Slowest Growth Since 2003
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia's residential property price survey shows that residential property price growth in the primary market slowed to +0.84% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: +1.46% YoY, 2Q25: +0.9% YoY). According to Trading Economics data as of Friday (7/11), this realization marks the weakest growth since the residential property price survey data was released by Bank Indonesia in 2003. Meanwhile, residential property sales in the primary market in 3Q25 contracted by -1.29% YoY (vs. 3Q24: -7.14% YoY, 2Q25: -3.8% YoY) due to the contraction in sales of medium-type houses by -12.27% YoY (vs. 3Q24: -8.8% YoY, 2Q25: -17.69% YoY) and large-type houses by -23% YoY (vs. 3Q24: +6.83% YoY, 2Q25: -14.95% YoY) amidst the growth in small-type house sales by +11.6% YoY (vs. 3Q24: -10.05% YoY, 2Q25: +6.7% YoY).

marketNews.title: News Regarding Foreign Investment by Danantara in Mecca
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Danantara has submitted a bid of $1 billion to purchase a plot of land near the Grand Mosque in Mecca to develop a haj village. According to Bloomberg sources, if the bid is successful, this will mark Danantara's first foreign investment. Danantara itself has not commented on this news. The plan by Danantara to develop the Haj Village in Mecca is an mandate from President Prabowo Subianto, who wants to facilitate Indonesian citizens in performing the Hajj pilgrimage.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Subsidiary Denies Rumors of Chartering Vessel from CBRE Consortium Member
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea, through its subsidiary, PT Hafar Daya Konstruksi (HDK), confirmed that the company has no affiliation, ownership relationship, or any cooperation whatsoever with Cakra Buana Resources Energi (CBRE). HDK Vice President Director, Dito Danarianto Sudarbo, stated that the joint operation between HDK and PT Gunanusa Utama Fabricators (Gunanusa) - which is the EPCIC service provider for the Petronas project in the North Madura II working area - did not charter a vessel from CBRE. This statement emerged after Bloomberg Technoz reported that CBRE had secured a vessel charter contract from the PTRO consortium. Previously, CBRE announced the chartering of 1 vessel unit to Gunanusa, without mentioning the joint operation between HDK and Gunanusa.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Director Irsyad Sahroni Acquires Approximately 1 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: ISAT: Indosat Director, Irsyad Sahroni, purchased approximately 1 million ISAT shares at an average price of 1,911 rupiah per share during the period of October 31 - November 3, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Irsyad Sahroni's direct ownership stake in ISAT increased from none to 0.0032%.

tickerNews.title: FILM Commissioner Sanjeva Advani Sells Approximately 1.7 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: FILM: MD Entertainment Commissioner, Sanjeva Advani, sold approximately 1.7 million FILM shares at an average price of 5,300 rupiah per share on October 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 8.7 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Sanjeva Advani's direct ownership stake in FILM decreased from 0.047% to 0.029%.

tickerNews.title: CITA Secures $100 Million Credit Facility from DBS, OCBC NISP, and Bank DBS Indonesia
tickerNews.content: CITA: Cita Mineral Investindo obtained a credit facility worth US$100 million from DBS Bank Ltd., Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Limited, and Bank OCBC NISP (NISP), with PT Bank DBS Indonesia acting as agent and collateral agent. The facility will be used for working capital and general short-term purposes of the company. The facility has an interest rate of SOFR + 0.5%, with a 12-month tenor that is extendable.

tickerNews.title: DNET Obtains up to IDR 450 Billion Term Loan from Bank Mandiri (BMRI)
tickerNews.content: DNET: Indoritel Makmur Internasional obtained a term loan facility of up to 450 billion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI), consisting of 2 tranches with tenors of 5 and 7 years, amounting to up to 225 billion rupiah each. This facility is intended to finance cash flow gaps/deficits for investment and/or general needs of the company.
